body.name: Epson Pro EX9240 3-Chip 3LCD Full HD 1080p Wireless Projector, 4,000 Lumens Color Brightness, 4,000 Lumens White Brightness, Miracast, 2 HDMI Ports, Built-in Speaker, 16,000:1 Contrast Ratio
body.stockDetail: Only 2 left in stock - order soon.
features: Amazing brightness — 4,000 lumens of color and white brightness (1) ideal for displaying large-group presentations, spreadsheets and videos, even in well-lit rooms
Stunning image quality — amazing Full HD 1080p resolution delivers crisp text and images; perfect for displaying professional-quality presentations, video and more

True 3-Chip 3LCD technology — displays 100% of the RGB color signal for every frame, providing outstanding color accuracy while maintaining excellent color brightness, without any distracting “rainbowing” or “color brightness” issues seen with other projection technologies

Wireless connectivity — including screen mirroring with Miracast, plus two HDMI ports, so you can easily video conference and connect streaming devices, including Fire TV, Apple TV, Roku and Chromecast (2)
Get up and running in no time — with easy image adjustments and convenient control like 1-1.6x optical zoom, horizontal slider and auto vertical correction
Incredible sound — built-in 16 W speaker for astounding audiovisual experience and incredible sound quality right out of the box
Built-in picture skew sensor — automatically analyzes the picture and instantly corrects the vertical keystone to help square the image
Amazing dynamic contrast ratio up to 16,000:1 — provides crisp, rich detail for graphs, images and videos

GET MORE, SPEND LESS: One Caseta smart switch can control many bulbs at once; Make many bulbs smart, even your existing bulbs. Get smart control of multiple styles of LED, incandescent, and halogen bulbs
body.description: Impress your audience and own the room with the ultra bright, wireless Pro EX9240 WUXGA projector, offering 4,000 lumens of color and white brightness (1) to deliver crisp, detailed, professional-quality presentations, spreadsheets and videos – even in well-lit spaces. From home offices to large video conference rooms, this sleek, compact projector makes it easy to display captivating, big-screen images from nearly any location, using advanced 3-chip 3LCD technology, stunning Full HD 1080p resolution and versatile screen mirroring with Miracast. Perfect for creating dynamic, engaging presentations, the Pro EX9240 offers a built-in 16 W speaker, allows for easy Zoom video conferencing and conveniently connects to streaming devices, such as Fire TV, Apple TV, Roku, and Chromecast, through the HDMI ports so you can easily share a variety of rich content, including movies, TV shows and more (2). 1. Color brightness (color light output) and white brightness (white light output) will vary depending on usage conditions. Color light output measured in accordance with IDMS 15.4; white light output measured in accordance with ISO 21118. 2. Requires wireless network connection of 5 Mbps or faster. Some apps require paid subscriptions. 3. For convenient and reasonable recycling options, visit epson.com/recycle 4. SmartWay is an innovative partnership of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have owned quite a few projectors but being cheap, I have not boughten the expensive ones. This projector has the best picture for the price of any that I have owned. It is amazingly bright and sharp. Once I've had time to use it, I will return to add to this review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bright, clear and easily set up.
reviews.reviewText: We use this to a Zoom Sabbath School at our church. Much better than our previous Toshiba. We only use it at about 50% brightness level. Little pricey.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Well, it's good
reviews.reviewText: I do like it. I'm not doing cartwheels but it does the job affordably.I got it to replace my 720 resolution Epson. It's nice and bright and clear. I've liked my previous Epson but I was getting to where I'd want to read some of the smaller text on the screen and 720 just doesn't cut it.A lot of the other reviews are right though..... it's about twice as loud as my older machine. That's a drag, but I think I can live with it. I only just bought it, so we'll see. Also don't know how long the bulbs will last. The older machine has been good. Only had to replace a bulb once in about 5 years.The other thing I've gotta say though is that it suffers from modern simplified code that forces a monitor presence if you connect it to your computer (via HDMI anyway). This caused the computer to BSOD crash. My older Epson has a manual monitor source connect setting, so the computer lets it go gracefully when I turn it off. This one digs in and holds on as long as it's plugged in, whether it's switched on or off. And even when there's no power with the HDMI is still plugged in, it holds on, and the Desktop still thinks there's another monitor, so your mouse arrow can go sailing into the ether of a phantom desktop screen. This does have a source connect button, but it still jumps ahead and connects before asked, and stays there.Other than those things, it's fine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent! Highly recommend!
reviews.reviewText: This projector exceeded my expectations. I needed a projector that would be bright enough to use with a lot of ambient natural light as well as lighting for the room.As you see in the photo, I teach classes outdoors, sheltered by my garage, with a tent to extend the teaching space (behind the view of this pic). So whether high noon sunshine or after sunset dark, I need the projection to be clear from the front to the back of class. And it is! Very bright. And I have it set at 50% on Presentation Mode.It has WiFi built it. So devices can connect directly. I have an old Apple TV connected to play movies or YouTube selections. DRM protected video will not play directly off your device. It requires a laptop.It’s full HD. My old one was very bright with HD, but nowhere near so bright or sharp as this one.Split screen feature is nice.The audio is lacking. But you can use a Bluetooth speaker. I connect the audio directly from my laptop to the Bluetooth speaker. I can also set Apple TV to choose the same Bluetooth speaker by default. The projector does NOT have Bluetooth. But if your device/laptop DOES have Bluetooth, you’re all set.It’s also quieter than my old projector. And lighter. Less heat blowing off it too. All the kids instantly saw the brightness and sharpness as they walked up to class! And I don’t use a proper screen! It’s a textured extra wide shower curtain that fits the width of my garage to both hide stuff behind it and serve as a projector! It would be even more amazing on a proper screen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The only projector you'll need
reviews.reviewText: I am absolutely happy with my purchase. A few months in, and I can finally say, it's worth the cost. This is the best projector for the cost you'll get. Don't go cheap, don't be fooled. Get this epson projector and be happy :) Will update later :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great projector for teaching/videos but bad speaker
reviews.reviewText: Perfect projector for a teacher. Everything is clear even with the classroom lights on. Video and video presentations are clear.CON- speakers suck. You will have to bluetooth the audio to another speaker for it to sound decent. It is audible but I need my speakers to have BASS or I get annoyed by the thin sound.CON- super expensive. Obviously, it’s an investment but still. I feel like since there is not a lot of “traffic” with projectors, we are paying a hefty fee for tech that should probably be more aroubd $200 at most.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great in the classroom
reviews.reviewText: I teach so I use projectors all the time. I use them in classrooms with windows and ambient light. The EX9220 has no issue in the classroom. The image shows up bright and clear even with full lights on. Of course it's best in a completely darkened room but this one does very nicely for what we use it for. It is wireless and uses Miracast to wirelessly project photos, slides, etc. You cannot use Miracast to project copyright movies so don't be disappointed if you can't play a favorite movie off your phone or touchpad. You can play movies you took. You will need another stand-alone device for that. You can plug in direct using HDMI and play your movies. I'm not a terribly fussy person and so I think the picture quality is great. The colors really pop, too. Setup was no issue for me but I do this all the time on multiple platforms so I'm a bit biased on that opinion. I've had no issues with this projector and have been using it for a couple weeks.
My first projector and the picture quality in any lighting condition is excellent

reviews.reviewTitle: El mejor proyector que puedes adquirir, sin duda.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Es un excelente proyector, el mejor sin duda y a un súper precio. Lo recibí pronto, antes de la fecha prevista. La calidad se ve desde el empaquetado hasta sus accesorios. No caliente casi nada, es súper silencioso y la calidad de imagen es genial. Lo recomiendo ampliamente para tus proyecciones de películas en full HD en formato nativo WUXGA. Me encantan sus colores y las funciones para adecuarse a tu superficie de proyección. Enhorabuena por EPSON.

reviews.reviewTitle: En año y medio, ninguna queja. Cumplió mis despectivas.
reviews.reviewText: En año y medio, ninguna queja. Cumplió mis despectivas. Vídeos muy nítidos, con buena resolución. Silencioso.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well for office or living room but is not a cinema/theater projector.
reviews.reviewText: Ive been using this for bit now, trying to really get a good judge of it compared to my LG ultra short throw projector and ive been really impressed with it overall. It has great video with very vivid colours, a good sharp resolution projection and multitudes of connection options.While this is a business projector, it does function pretty well and surpasses my LG on all levels apart from this being a long throw projector. The business projector basically means that they cut the contrast a bit, and made the light brighter for presentations in a fully windowed room... As such this is really best suited for a meeting room but also functions well for an entertainment unit in the living room during daytime hours. If you want a home theater experience, you're best bet is an actual home theater projector such as the HC2100 which isnt as bright but offers more contrast and is a designed for a home theater experience.Setting the projector is pretty straightforward, connect the power, hdmi cable to your computer or dvd player, turn it on and setup the tilt, skew ect. It does offer full control on the image left, right, up, down, upside down and also allows you to set the exact corner of your screen so you get the full view. It works well, nothing different from most other projectors above the 400 dollar price.The unit is quite compact, taking up roughly 12 inches wide, 10 inches deep and 4 inches tall, but be sure to leave space around the sides and back for the exhaust. The exhaust fan on eco mode is barely audible but on normal mode its comparable to a laptop fan when on full blast, quite noisy. The controls are easy to understand, remote offers easy navigation and you can literally aim the remote anywhere in the room and it will work, no need to aim it at the unit.The colours are very vivid, even more so than the monitor im using to type this (B286HK), however I don't think the colour accuracy is too realistic.... But good luck finding and projector that claims this. The dark levels are somewhat disappointing, definitely not the darkest blacks ive seen, a mere dark gray on any active iris setting. The brightness is very bright normal setting, more than adequate to have open blinds on a sunny day. On eco mode you can see the screen as well but it the colours and screen are not as vivid, for obvious reasons. In comparison to my other projector, this is heads and toes above it in all accounts.The sound, while adequate is only sufficient for basic sounds, such as a tv show but dont expect to be able to watch an action packed movie with it. The sound is pretty good for any projector that ive heard though, but the best comparison I can give you is by hooking up a cheaper bluetooth speaker(like 30 dollars cheap).... the bluetooth speaker is better, so thats what ive been using connecting the computer sound to the 3.5mm jack on the bluetooth speaker.... The projector lacks bass and mids but highs are clear and crisp.Connectivity has been pretty good overall, but the real thing ive found is the wireless casting is jumpy and inadequate for video. Its really only to be used for presentations and pictures, even standard def video is jumpy and skips with the wifi router in the same room. The rest of the connections work well though.There is really only one complaint I have with this projector, that is that it produces a distinctive sound, a faint but audible high tone, mid tone and low tone that repeats, it sounds similar to a ballast going bad in a fluorescent fixture. Its louder when the projector is cold and nearly goes away when its been running for 15 minutes but still audible. When the videos sound is going, you cannot hear it but when browsing the web you can hear it from about 5 feet away. It gets annoying...Anyways, its been good so far as long as you keep everything above in mind. As ive said, its not a theater projector, but one designed for use in day light or lit up rooms. If you're looking for a home theater projector, there are more suitable ones available.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Business Projector but not perfect for Home Theater
reviews.reviewText: The EX9220 is an excellent business projector. It has excellent Colour and White Brightness at 3600 lumens, and good contrast at 15000, which is more than enough brightness and contrast for any room, regardless of how bright that room is to start off with. This projector also does quite well as a home projector too, but arguably has a much higher brightness then would be required in most situations at home – essentially, for the home, you be better off opting for a cheaper less bright model, such as the Epson Home Cinema 2100 1080p projector which performs just as well in the home for half the price. The brightness and contrast are really overkill for the home environment, so you only need to step up to this model if you really need that extra brightness to light up even the brightest conference rooms – read floor to ceiling glass window conference room. a, if you're looking for a high end home projector, there are also other models that cater more to that environment that this model does – ones that are less bright, have better black levels, and have quieter cooling fans. At lower brightness levels, there fan noise is not n issue, but once you cranked up, fan noise becomes clearly audible. As you might expect, cranking out 3600 lumens, can generate a lot of heat.The projector also has all the necessary connections you'd expect, as well as built in speaker which is fine for small presentations, but you'd be better of jacking your source into rooms audio system if you're looking for quality audio. In this regard, remember to run your sound/hdmi to the sound system first, then to the projector, and not the other way around (This unit does not have dedicated audio out ports) This is to be expected with most projectors and should not really be considered a negative.This projector resolution is 1920 x 1200 WUXGA which is a fairly standard laptop wide screen resolution, and is idea with wide screen 16:10 ratio presentations (which is somewhat standard these days). The projector is also capable of your standard 1080p 16:9 ratio to, which is what you'd be using if want to uses it in the home environment.Performance – crisp, clean, good colour preproduction and very bright. (That's the difference between a quality projector and those cheaper non name projectors) Setup was easy, menu systems are well laid out, and the wifi miracast connect worked smoothly. The bulb is rated for about 6000 hrs, or 10K in ecomode and it's replacement costs a reasonable $70. The inclusion of a case as also a welcome addition with this unit.Recommendations – highly recommended if you need a quality business projector. Don't fall prey to those cheaper no name projectors who's stats are misreported, and resulting image is dull, faded and washed out. If you're looking for a home theater projector you can probably find something for half the price – such as the Epson Home Cinema 2100 1080p.Really only have one criticism – for some reason they opted to include an outdated vga cord instead of an HDIM cord – strange choice given most modern laptops don't even have a vga port anymore.
